aroma.notes: Smooth and creamy but nothing distinct.

acidity.notes: Smooth, glowing tropical fruit. One very citrus, almost metallic note, increases as cools â€” more intense than lemon, so that must be the lime note.

sweetness.notes: Well-balanced with a creamy nuance. Not quite as lively as last cup, so complexity may have been subdued by overextraction.

finish.notes: Teeth feel wonderfully minty after sip, but tongue feels dry after only a few sips. Alkaline taste left in mouth. Not as lasting a finish as previous cup.

flavor: Overall taste is still glowing like a sunset with tropical fruit, lime, and cream, but cup is noticeably astringent compared to last.
observations: Accidentally did 80g water for swirl bloom. Drawdown in last third was very slow, drip by drip.
actionItem: Slightly overextracted. Use 70g of water and research at what water level Rao spin works best.
